newsitem.title: JAPAN: APPLE JAPAN SAYS MICROSOFT TIE-UP NOT TAKEOVER.
newsitem.headline: APPLE JAPAN SAYS MICROSOFT TIE-UP NOT TAKEOVER.

text.p: A tie-up between Apple Computer Inc and Microsoft Corp does not mean Apple has been taken over by Microsoft, Apple's Japanese unit said on Thursday.
"Yesterday's announcement (on Apple's tie-up with Microsoft) does not mean at all that Apple has been taken over," Eiko Harada, president of Apple Computer's Japanese unit, told a news conference.
Apple Computer and Microsoft ended a bitter rivalry on Wednesday by saying Microsoft would invest $150 million in the troubled computer maker.
Under the deal, Microsoft will invest $150 million in Apple stock and develop more programmes for the Macintosh.
Apple also replaced all but two of its directors, but stopped short of naming a new chairman of the board.
Harada also said that the tie-up ensures further growth of Apple Computer's business.
He added that the tie-up would not bring any change in how Apple Japan conducted business in Japan.
